definition: to meet a challenge
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to fight/fight/war/battle

sentences.english: We have taken on a task that will be difficult, but the people of the Empire are ready for the challenge.
sentences.chinese: 任重而道远，但帝国的子民们已做好迎接挑战的准备。

sentences.english: Measures should be taken pertinently to receive challenges.
sentences.chinese: 应有针对性地采取措施，迎接挑战。

sentences.english: But I also believe that we cannot lose the opportunity to meet this challenge.
sentences.chinese: 但我也想深我们不能错过这个迎接挑战的机会。

sentences.english: The School of Fine Arts of Chengdu University will grasp the opportunities and face the challenges to create fruitful future again.
sentences.chinese: 成都大学美术学院将抓住机遇，迎接挑战，再创辉煌。

sentences.english: Receive Challenge, Serve "Agriculture, Countryside and Peasant", Develop the Self-study Examination of High Education Steadily.
sentences.chinese: 迎接挑战，服务三农，稳步发展高教自考。

sentences.english: We choose to deal with challenges now rather than leaving them for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 我们选择现在迎接挑战而非将其留给后代。

sentences.english: The question is whether leaders can cooperate in steering these changes.
sentences.chinese: 现在的问题是，各国领导人能否精诚合作，迎接挑战。

sentences.english: Meet the challenge, and make a break-through.
sentences.chinese: 迎接挑战，才能有所突破。

sentences.english: Ericsson is looking forward to meet the challenges and win the future together with Cable & Media customers.
sentences.chinese: 爱立信希望和广电客户一起携手迎接挑战，同创未来。

sentences.english: The question is whether leaders can cooperate in steering the changes.
sentences.chinese: 现在的问题是，各国领导人能否团结合作，迎接挑战。

definition: proactive
to dare to/to be brave enough to
to advance bravely
to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
to advance bravely/to endeavor
to lay down a heavy burden
to meet/to welcome/to greet
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
brave/courageous
to set sail on a voyage to a distant place/(fig.) to undertake a great mission
to struggle/to wrestle
having high fighting spirit
to guard against pride and impatience (idiom); to remain modest and keep cool
see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
to put one's all into the fight
to show initiative/to be a go-getter/to push forward with one's agenda
